attributes.action: Require companies with 100+ employees to offer a bike2work scheme to all staff
attributes.background:
Many large companies do not offer a bike2work scheme for no reason other than lazyness. 

Lots more people would cycle given the opportunity to do so and as the government is aware cycles are a massive aid in reducing both emissions and congestion it'll benefit everyone in various ways
attributes.additional_details:
It's proven cycling is good for health, less strain on NHS

Cycling instead of driving reduces emissions - less strain on NHS, better for planet, and helps meet city air pollution requirements

Less congestion meaning more profitable businesses, more interest in business, easier access to emergency services

Healthier work forces - less early retirments on medical.grounds, less sick pay etc

attributes.action: Make carers allowance payable to carers after they reach pensionable age.
attributes.background: I have cared for my husband for the last 18+years after he sustained a traumatic brain injury. I had to give up my full time job to do this and now I find that I am going to loose CA  when I  reach pensionable age which I feel is grossly unfair as I am still a full time carer.

attributes.action: Legalise bow hunting in the UK
attributes.background:
I am petitioning as a fellow bowman to relegalise bow hunting. It has been a skillful way of supplying meat since the ancient times.

But now, in the UK, it is all done by guns, and bows are no longer legal. There is neither any explanation as to why it is illegalised. But we can change that.
attributes.additional_details:
The difference between guns and bows are as follows;
Bullets can get lost in your game, only to be found painfully when eating the game - Arrows get taken out soon after game is caught.
Guns are loud, scaring the animal before it dies - Bows are not as loud, if without silencers, still allowing a more humane hunt.
Gun fumes and bullet/shell remains are pollutable - Arrows are collected if found.
Bows are lighter but more convenient to that of loading a gun, which emmits noise.

attributes.action: Reinstate DLA for those with mental health or learning disabilities.
attributes.background: Personal Independence Payments criteria is frightfully ill-suited for those claimants that have a form of learning difficulty or mental health condition. The PIP criteria is dreadfully preposterous for this division of society. We are asking the government to reinstate DLA for these groups.
attributes.additional_details:
We would like the government to reconsider their options in regards to reinstating the Disability Living Allowance Criteria for this group of claimants. The following links back up the point of this petition.
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/dwp-fit-to-work-assessments-cost-more-than-they-save-report-reveals-a6801636.html
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/dwp-mental-health-discrimination-pip-cuts-mobility-mind-a7629866.html

attributes.action: Implement transitional employment for service leavers and veterans
attributes.background: Service leavers and veterans are currently discharged from service with no guarantee of transitional employment that would allow time for decompression of physical/mental health recovery. Service can be a long period of institutionalised pattern setting for veterans. There is a need for adjustment.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/former-soldier-mp-says-veterans-12084010

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-5426377/Freed-Royal-Marine-Alexander-Blackman-gets-new-job.html

Veterans make up 1 in 10 of the UK populous, we have upto 10000 in the HM prison service and 7,000 rough sleeping, about 170,000 working age veterans are unemployed or economically inactive with a veteran suicide every two weeks!

We need a significant change in support services!

attributes.action: Ban the sale, manufacture or distribution of plastic confetti in the UK.
attributes.background: Plastic confetti is still used at weddings and parties despite it being a dramatic example of littering non-biodegradable materials.  Confetti is designed to be small and light to 'float' when thrown and therefore it is very hard to pick up and will spread widely in the wind. It has to go!
attributes.additional_details: Today I saw Branscombe Beach on Devon covered in silver and gold confetti.  There was so much it was impossible to collect it all and it was very hard to pick up as it was so thin and small.  This kind of littering has to stop and individuals celebrating need to be prevented from making environmentally damaging choices such as this. When so many other options are available,  plastic confetti needs up be banned.

attributes.action: Remove GDPR from UK law as soon as we leave the EU in March 2019.
attributes.background: GDPR has probably been the worst piece of red tape to come out of the EU, its extremely costly to businesses, mainly to small businesses who don’t have massive legal departments and staff in place to swallow up the regulation. GDPR is also extremely damaging to our economy.
attributes.additional_details: The UK voted to leave the EU 2 years ago and we are still having to put up with the ridiculously damaging and annoying regulations. It is believed that the cost of GDPR to UK businesses has already run into the billions, with many small business not at all geared up to deal with it.

attributes.action: Put fainting and epileptic seizure advice in all public transport buildings
attributes.background: With unprecedented levels of people fainting on the London Underground, I am urging the government to intervene by ensuring adequate fainting and epilepsy advice is clearly signposted in all (or most) public transport stations and buildings so people can be helped immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-44953440 
https://www.epilepsy.com/living-epilepsy/driving-and-transportation/transportation
https://www.epilepsy.org.uk/info/firstaid
https://www.standard.co.uk/news/transport/revealed-the-most-common-time-for-people-to-faint-on-the-tube-a3973216.html

attributes.action: Insist the UK Government reject advice of the Senior Salaries Review for Judges
attributes.background: The Senior Salaries Review Body has recommended a pay rise of 32% for Judges. The reason given is low moral and changes to their pensions. With many Civil Servants receiving 1% for 10 years in a row, this is totally unacceptable. The Government cannot accept this whilst we are still in austerity
attributes.additional_details: As reported in many newspapers and the BBC on 12 October 2018.

attributes.action: Require free admission for more than one carer with a disabled client.
attributes.background: As a carer for disabled people it frustrates me when myself and other carers take disabled clients to attractions such as the zoo and are unable to get in as they only allow one carer in for free. A lot of individuals with additional needs have two carers for a reason, not just for show.
attributes.additional_details:
So why should the disabled client, that cannot work, have to pay for the second carer to get in when it's ok for one carer to get in for free. I feel like associations do not realise how much this impacts individuals with additional needs enjoying their lives as they cannot afford it. 
The human rights act 1998 states: 
Right of life 
Freedom of assembly and association 
Protection from discrimination 
Right to education 
 
So why is this a issue in disabled individuals lives on a day to day basis. The Government needs to intervene and make this a legal requirement.

attributes.action: Stop animals being given away as prizes or sold at funfairs.
attributes.background: Carnival fish are often kept in poor conditions in small bags. These bags become very hot on warm days and will run out of oxygen. They're given without any advice on how to care for them. Goldfish live on average 5-10 years in captivity however carnival fish often die shortly after being given.

attributes.action: Make gender-neutral passports available for British citizens
attributes.background: The UK government currently allows only 'M'/'F' gender markers on travel documents, which effectively erases many non-binary and intersex people. I would urge the government to recognise these already marginalised groups.
attributes.additional_details:
In a recent dispute the high court was told gender-neutral passports would affect legislation, be prohibitively expensive and increase the need for consular support for British citizens.

None of which negates the fact that we still need them, whatever the cost, and that if legislation doesn't account for non-binary and intersex people, it badly needs revising.
 
Gender-neutral passports are already recognised internationally. Ten countries currently offer a third gender option, 'X', or unknown.

attributes.action: Make minimum wage and benefits the same regardless of age as it’s discrimination
attributes.background: It’s discriminatory for under 25s to get paid less for the same job as someone over 25. Also, if you’re single and under 35, you can only get Housing Benefit for bed-sit accommodation or a single room in shared accommodation.

attributes.action: Change 30 free hour childcare to a monthly sign-up and not a term sign-up.
attributes.background: Parents who get a full time job need to then put their child into care immediately, so need the support immediately and not on a term by term basis, you can't sign up when you don't have a job but when you do, you have to wait until the new term starts. If this was monthly it would make sense.

attributes.action: Classify professional avoidable negligence as a criminal act
attributes.background: Of course mistakes happen, but too many are avoidable, and are classified as 'civil'. Many are not subject to criminal investigation, when sometimes this should be the case. 'Individuals' should also be held accountable. This would be a deterrent and lower the authority compensation liability.
attributes.additional_details: Professionals with a duty of care be it medical, social care, community or residential care that cause avoidable physical or mental harm, abuse, neglect or death through direct involvement and incorrect decision making, should be fully investigated through the justice system and the crown prosecution service and charged with criminal neglect. The logic is that it would encourage professionals to think twice and provide a strong deterrent when making hasty, rash and bias life changing decisions.

attributes.action: Let women set a cap on how much they will claim from the father of their child
attributes.background: The law disregards agreements made by women who conceive via sperm donation without using a clinic. This puts men who help them at risk of getting a huge bill. Many are deterred; among them those who could bring most to the self-image, aspirations and aptitudes of the children.
attributes.additional_details:
A legally recognised ‘limit of liability’ would give security to the donor while allowing scope for some agreed financial contribution. This could:

avoid the need for secrecy and anonymity

provide more money for poorer families

make sperm donation a practical alternative to getting pregnant in an unsatisfactory or short-term relationship

start a virtuous circle of better donors and higher regard for sperm donation

For comments, questions and discussion please go to:

limitofliability.blogspot.co.uk

attributes.action: Make all products state on the label whether they have used animal testing
attributes.background: Many people are against animal testing or want to reduce the number of products they buy that use it but there isn't enough information in store about the companies that use animal testing so people are generally unaware about the extent of it. This addition would allow a more informed choice.
attributes.additional_details: Due to medical progress now, many agree that animal testing should only be used when completely necessary yet the U.K. are still estimated to be in the top 9 testers in the world. People should be more aware of what's go in to the product in front of them, right there in the shop without having to search online. At total of 3.79 million experiments were conducted by the U.K. In 2017

attributes.action: Change the CMS definition of full time education to include degree level.
attributes.background: Currently the provisions state that maintenance is paid until the child is 16 or until 20 if the child continues in full time education BUT ONLY to the end of ‘A’ levels or equivalent. This needs to change to support our children going on to advanced education ie university to include degree level

attributes.action: A minimum prison sentence of 10 years for attempting to meet after grooming.
attributes.background: Too many crimes are being committed against children on a daily basis, these are wrecking their childhoods and are given poor sentences. I want to see a minimum of 10 yrs for attempting to meet a child after grooming. Not suspended and only rehabiltate inside away from our children. Give us justice.

attributes.action: Review eligibility(prior degree) for the Masters loan for the LLM Legal Practice
attributes.background: A long distance Masters degree, which I struggled to pay for in instalments, has now made me ineligible to apply for a Postgraduate loan to study the Legal Practice Course, which I need to become a solicitor. I now face trying to fund this course via expensive loans or not qualifying at all.
attributes.additional_details: Law graduates who struggled to privately fund a Masters as they could not afford the LPC, are not-eligible for the Post graduate loan. The LPC is the main practice course which enables them become Solicitors. The additional LLM on top of the Legal Practice Course(LPC) is an additional dissertation to qualify the LPC for the Masters Loan. I pray that the eligibilty rule which exempts Law graduates with a previous higher qualification from applying for a Masters loan to study the LPC be reviewed.

attributes.action: Give the RSPCA Statutory Powers to investigate animal welfare complaints
attributes.background: When the RSPCA receives calls on the 24-hour cruelty line its officers are not allowed to intervene and stop any abuse they discover until the Police arrive. The Police having their hands full as it is, cannot always guarantee a quick response which only prolongs the animal's suffering.
attributes.additional_details:
Giving the RSPCA statutory powers (like the Scottish and Irish SPCA) would: 
a) eliminate this waiting for the Police nonsense
b) allow RSPCA inspectors to enter private land where they suspect animal cruelty is taking place
c) allow RSPCA inspectors to remove abused or suffering animals

There are monsters who inflict unjustified suffering on defenseless creatures and RSPCA's role is vital to save animal lives and prevent  cruelty.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to humanely kill and eat dogs in the UK.
attributes.background: The killing and eating of a dog is only illegal if the method of slaughter is deemed to have caused unnecessary suffering - otherwise eating the meat is still allowed in the UK. The government must make this a criminal offence.

attributes.action: Publish details of the preparations taken in case of ‘no deal’ exit from the EU
attributes.background: The Government has shelved plans to publish details of planing for a no deal exit.  These plans will affect everyone in the UK and therefore it is within the public interest to see these plans.  This petition calls on the government to publish the plans allowing the public to see the preparations

attributes.action: Form a Government of National Unity to oversee Brexit
attributes.background: Following the resignation of Neville Chamberlain in 1940, a cross-party government of national unity was formed with Churchill as PM and Attlee as deputy PM.  The U.K. is facing a similar national emergency now, and we need a similar remedy now.
attributes.additional_details:
Wikipedia entry on Churchill/Attlee Wartime Administration. 

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Churchill_war_ministry

attributes.action: Make GI labels on foods in stores and restaurant menus a requirement
attributes.background: I suffer from Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome, as 1 in 8 women do across the country. The chronic illness that I have involves a symptom called Insulin Resistance which involves a very restrictive Low GI diet and exercise routine in order to keep manageable. The illness is linked with Type 2 diabetes.
attributes.additional_details: Last year alone, 3.7 million people in the UK were diagnosed with diabetes and it's estimated to rise to 5 million by 2025 if nothing changes. Food is our medicine when it comes to PCOS so I feel like the GI levels being printed on food will help lower the diabetes diagnosis rates in the UK. This is already a requirement in Austriallia: https://www.gisymbol.com/reading-food-labels/

attributes.action: Make 30 hours free child care available to all working parents including non-EU
attributes.background:
The conservative government introduced the 30 hours free child care to all working parents in 2016. This was a very welcomed news as it will help greatly with childcare costs.

I was greatly shocked to realise that we were NOT eligible for the 30hrs because of our immigration status(outside EEA).
attributes.additional_details:
Myself and my husband have been residents in this country for 9 years and we are both working, paying our taxes and NI. We are not entitled to public funds including child tax credit or child benefit.

It is UNFAIR that we get taxed as other working parents/ persons but we are denied the 30 hours free child care. This is harsh, unjust, unacceptable and discriminately. 


https://www.gov.uk/government/news/government-brings-forward-plans-to-double-free-childcare-for-working-families

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to upload ID when opening a new social media account
attributes.background: Uploading ID and proof of address when creating a new social media account in order to identify a person and to cut down on fake accounts and trolling. If we can identify who is behind a social media account maybe there wouldn’t be as much trolling.
attributes.additional_details: Social media has become very negative in the last 5 years and people of all ages feel pressured to be a certain way and to act happy even though deep down they could be in great pain. It is easy to put on a front to followers and people don’t feel they can talk to anybody about the way they are feeling because they have to come across a certain way to people they do not know.

attributes.action: Remove the Home Office exemption from the Data Protection Act
attributes.background: The Home Office has been given an exemption from GDPR and the data protection Act 2018. Citizens have a right to know what is being discussed with regard to their cases and an exemption puts us at risk of more scandals such as windrush.
attributes.additional_details: Citizens should not be denied the right to their data and further exclusions from society.

attributes.action: Centrally Fund a Tram or Underground for the Leeds-Bradford City Region
attributes.background: The West Yorkshire Urban Area is home to a population of approximately 2.3million people. If less wealthy countries are able to ensure their sizeable cities have mass transit systems, it should be of national concern that the UK, as the 9th wealthiest country in the world, is unwilling to do so.
attributes.additional_details: Any urban area within Europe of a similar size has either a tram, light rail, or underground network – some have two of the three. Examples include Turin, Prague, Vienna, Stockholm, Lyon, and our neighbours Manchester. HM Treasury figures show that London receives nearly £2600 per person in transport spending whereas Yorkshire and Humber receives £160. Transport for the North estimates the North is owed a £59 billion catch-up spend to bring our level of investment up to London spending.

attributes.action: Launch an inquiry into the possible link between cannabis and violence
attributes.background: Cannabis is a common factor in an alarming number of violent crimes, including murder, rape and child abuse, as well as suicide. As calls for the legalisation of cannabis grow ever louder, we demand the government first investigate the possible link between cannabis and violence.
attributes.additional_details: As documented in this blog, https://attackersmokedcannabis.com/, cannabis is a common factor in hundreds of violent crimes that have occurred in the UK and Ireland in the past two decades.

attributes.action: Increase awareness of asthma in under 5 year olds.
attributes.background: The Government must raise awareness among GPs and healthcare professionals to increase the diagnosis of asthma in children under 5. When a child with asthma isn’t diagnosed until they are 5 it is especially hard. I understand it can indicate other conditions but it is a condition that can kill!
attributes.additional_details: Recently I was nearly at the point of having to resuscitate my child, I had inhalers to ease until paramedics arrived but imagine if I didn’t have that “we can’t do anything with children under 5”. Thankfully at the age of 6 months I managed to push and push the doctors for a steroid inhaler alongside his blue inhaler but it took my son to have an asthma attack at 6 months old and a trip to A&E for them to realise.

attributes.action: Ban the use of disposable plastics, plastic toys  & plastic bags in the UK.
attributes.background:
According to World Environmental Forum, we have become too depended on using plastics.
More than 8 million tons of it ends up in the ocean every year. If we continue to pollute at this rate, there will be more plastic than fish in the ocean by 2050.”
attributes.additional_details:
As a mother of 2 young children I feel now is the time to #endplasticuse4good.
I travelled to Kenya recently and I was surprised to discover that they have banned the use of plactic bags and so on.
We MUST all take action now to save our planet. Please support this petition!
The toy companies must be accountable and be charged for making plastic toys that are easily disposable!

attributes.action: Change the voting system to proportional representation, dump FPTP
attributes.background: Proportional representation means that vote share in the population matches the amount of seats each party gets in an election. First past the post creates a huge disparity between vote share and seats in the House of Commons, with parties receiving millions of votes and just one seat. Details below
attributes.additional_details:
2015 Election:

•Conservatives - 331 seats, 11,334,226 votes (36.9%)

•Labour - 232 seats, 9,347,273 votes (30.4%)

•UKIP - 1 seat, 3,881,099votes (12.6%)

•Liberal Democrats - 8 seats, 2,415,916  votes (7.9%)

•Green Party - 1 seat, 1,57,630 votes (3.8%)


2017 Election:

•Conservatives - 318 seats, 13,636,684 votes (42.4%)

•Labour - 262 seats, 12,877,918 votes (40.0%)

•Lib Dems - 12 seats, 2,371,861 votes (7.4%)

•UKIP - 0 seats, 594,068 votes (1.8%)

bbc.co.uk/news/election/2017/results

attributes.action: Fund mental health facilities for Salisbury
attributes.background: There is a serious lack of mental health services and support in Salisbury. This particularly affects full time employed persons who need to pay for treatment because counselling is no longer available on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: The closest counselling services available for face to face sessions are Melksham, Southampton and Andover. For full time employees, receiving time off work is very difficult. There’s also the cost of paying for travel on top of the sessions. There are regular suicides in our city and people are crying out for some kind of regular service. Services should include DBT and more in depth CBT therapies and classes.

attributes.action: Establish quorum and meaningful majority criteria to validate future referenda.
attributes.background: Referendums are affecting the future of the UK. A 50.1% majority is slight and have left nearly half the electorate unsatisfied and discontented. Criteria such as the definition of a quorum would establish the initial validity of the referendum and more accurately reflect the will of the electorate.

attributes.action: Review sentencing to ensure it works for single victims of repeated abuse
attributes.background: I want the government to order a review of sentences for abuser. If they commit the same offence towards the same person repeatedly over a period of time, it should be treated much more seriously.
attributes.additional_details: An offender who repeatedly abused children for 10 years was charged with only 11 counts of rape, but the abuse had taken place over 10 years. The amount of time the child has been abused needs to count. The abused child has lost those years. Those 10 years count.

attributes.action: Make charging extortionate amounts for the equivalent gluten free items illegal
attributes.background: Gluten free items are typically at least double or triple the cost of standard items which is essentially exploitation against those genetically susceptible and intolerant/reactive to gluten. Is this not indirect discrimination, treating this population differently? This has been so hard for me.
attributes.additional_details:
A gluten free lifestyle can be tough enough without having to pay extortionate amounts for food and for small amounts. Its been difficult to switch to a gluten free diet not just physically and mentally but also financially. This should not be the case. 
Severe abdominal pain, fatigue, indigestion, bloating, vomiting and anaemia are just a few of the symptoms you can experience by eating gluten with such conditions like Celiac and IBS. Now, thousands of people are affected. We can help them.

attributes.action: Fund the provision of support dogs for assault or abuse survivors with PTSD.
attributes.background: The government could fund and support charities to be able to specifically help the availability of these dogs for sexual assault or domestic violence survivors instead the charities allowing only war veterans to obtain a emotional support dog in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: Studies have shown that 20 percent of soldiers come home for war with PTSD however they've also shown that out of all sexual assault, rape or domestic violence survivors that 30 percent have PTSD. Studies have also proved that 82 percent of people (in the USA) with an emotional support dog had a reduction in symptoms like anxiety attacks and nightmares than before and 40 percent reported that they reduced their use of medication. The impacts of these dogs is astronomical to someone's daily life.

attributes.action: Bring Welfare Assessments back to the DWP and scrap contracts with providers
attributes.background: There are widespread reports of Capita producing PIP and ESA assessments that are inaccurate, contain factual errors and ignore important evidence. There are too many appeals being lost by the DWP because of Capita's incompetence.
attributes.additional_details: People are being made seriously ill as a result of the appalling record of Capita’s assessments. It seems Capita make headlines about errors and omissions in all their govt contracts but the most serious is their atrocious record in Welfare assessments.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for 14-16 year olds to learn working life skills in school
attributes.background: It should be a compulsory part of the national curruculum for all students between the ages of 14-16 to be taught how to create a basic household budget,how to apply for job vacancies,how to conduct themselves at interviews,how to keep documentation of job's they have applied for.
attributes.additional_details: Stated above are fundamental subjects that should be covered within the national curriculum,as they are crucial life skills that will prepare our young people for a sturdy working life. As a parent of a school leaver i am teaching my child these things,i have a huge interest in my child's past and future education,however not all parents are equipped with the knowledge to teach life skills to their children,so i believe making it a compulsory subject in schools is the best way forward.

attributes.action: Devolve TV Broadcasting to Scottish Government Arts, Culture & Sport Ministry
attributes.background: British broadcasters have neglected their obligation to the people of Scotland, leaving it comparatively invisible in the networks,as there is a "huge accountability-gap" in Scotland as UK Government responsibility lies at Westminster instead of Scottish Government as it is with N. Ireland
attributes.additional_details:
We need to trust our politicians and institutions, devolvement  of television broadcasting would assist the need for transparency and responsibility for localised accountability within Scotland assuring a fairer and more balanced reporting in Scotland and the promotion of the Gaelic Language to Scots. 
At present, Scotland has the lowest proportion of TV Licence Fee to programming collecting £350 million with £89 million set aside for operating costs in Scotland leaving £281 million to go out.

attributes.action: Cut National Citizens Service funding and apply funds to schools and the NHS
attributes.background: In 2017 NCS recieved £180.5 million from the government and has proceeded to spend it on extravagant advertisements instead of the actual service. This money could be better used by schools which constantly face budget cuts and the NHS which is in desperate need of more funding.

attributes.action: Introduce an Unemployability Benefit for people unemployed for 5 years or more.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, want the UK Government to introduce an Unemployability Benefit, equivalent to the National Living Wage for a 35 hour week, for people unemployed for 5 years or more.
attributes.additional_details:
The majority of employers now refuse to employ people who have been out of work for any length of time - and they don't consider Volunteering and Work Placement experience as valuable: only formal, paid employment experience within the previous 6 months will suffice. 

This is leaving more and more unemployed people out of work for longer periods, claiming benefits for far longer than they want to, and open to harassment from Job Centre staff and the media.

attributes.action: Create a fairer child maintenance payment for all
attributes.background: Child maintenance is calculated on Gross Pay, rather than Net income. What you are paid and what you take home are very different amounts. Based on Gross, you pay far more child maintenance than you can afford.
attributes.additional_details: Paying on your net pay (what you actually see in your bank account) would mean you pay a fair amount of child maintenance. Not a hugely inflated figure, but a right and just amount.

attributes.action: Refer to disability as a “different ability” on official publications and in law
attributes.background: I do not believe that all “disabilities” put people at a disadvantage as implied by the term dis-ability. I believe this reference drives a thinking and culture that is not inclusive and supportive of many peoples varying abilities. I believe all references should refer to different abilities.
attributes.additional_details:
I was diagnosed with a form of learning “disability” in high school. From my perspective this ability has never been a detriment to me in fact in many ways it has been a strength as I learn very visually and so I am able to create simple views of complex information. 
 
However the cultural reference of a disability drives a lack of acceptance within the work place and society. 
 
Do you have a different ability and would like it recognised as such?
 
Small words have big affects.

attributes.action: Reintroduce the Eurasian lynx as soon as possible.
attributes.background: There are 1.5 million deer in the UK, which is a massive overpopulation. They are overgrazing our woodlands causing a significant loss in biodiversity. Reintroducing the lynx would be a long-term solution to this issue and would restore balance to the UK's ecosystems.
attributes.additional_details: The Lynx UK Trust published research documents about a lynx reintroduction in 2015. It is now 2018 and no action has been taken by the government. Our country is one of the most nature-depleted countries in the world, with 53% of our species in decline. I would suggest that the lynx be reintroduced within 1 year of this petition receiving 10,000 signatures, as we need to act fast. If you want to read more go to The Lynx UK Trust's website. The Government should approve the reintroduction licence as soon as possible.

attributes.action: Make it legal for horses to be ridden on pavements and walkways-safer all round!
attributes.background: Accidents involving horses cause serious injury. There are no clear guidelines for drivers in the highway code.  Most are not aware of horse behaviour and how to pass safely. For everyone's benefit, horses and riders are safer on pavements.

attributes.action: Allow Pubs/Clubs to have their own policy on tobacco consumption
attributes.background: The blanket ban on smoking in pubs and clubs is illiberal in a society that time and time again calls itself as a free one. There should be a removal of smoking bans in pubs, and the proprietors/owners themselves should be allowed to set their own policies for their own property.
attributes.additional_details: A society that values private property, freedom of choice and enterprise cannot simply impose a blanket ban, such as the ban on smoking in Pubs. This petition is designed to allow parliament to debate the effectiveness of each landlord being able to declare their pub as smoking/non-smoking as they see fit, with the same consequences and restrictions for those who smoke in non-smoking pubs as exist today.

attributes.action: Ban insurance companies from charging administration fees
attributes.background: Insurance companies are charging administration fees for starting/cancelling/amending policies when this work is all automated by the systems they have in place and the price charged is disproportional to the work involved.
attributes.additional_details: Insurance companies do not incur any extra printing or postage charges to make amendments to policies anymore as everything is online, any changes made are processed automatically through the system, the charges were first introduced to cover the cost of the paper and ink and postage for sending letters.

attributes.action: Scrap the NHS' National Child Measurement Programme for children in Year 6
attributes.background: Parents are told their child’s overweight if they're on the 91st centile (14% of Yr 6), but many are healthy. In a vulnerable child, this label can lead to eating disorders and THEN they become unhealthy. The scheme isn't working; child obesity at this age has continued to rise since it began.
attributes.additional_details: This NHS scheme hasn't lowered obesity rates, but much needed funding is spent on this ineffective scheme, as well as support for eating disorders that could have been triggered by it. Schools often feed children unhealthy meals but then weigh them and they are are obese. Eating disorders at this age are highly damaging as they delay puberty; children can't develop and grow, and mental well-being is drastically affected. This happened to me 2 years ago, age 11, when I was deemed 'overweight'.
